senses.de: to lift or move something to a higher position
senses.ex: Please raise your hand if you know the answer.

Tips.title: Physical Action
Tips.description: Often used when someone performs a physical action to move something upwards.
Tips.example: The workers raised the beams to secure the structure.

Tips.title: Sign of Respect
Tips.description: 'Raise' is used in contexts of respect or tribute, such as a salute or anthem.
Tips.example: Everyone raised their glasses to toast the newlyweds.

senses.de: to increase the amount, level, or strength of something
senses.ex: The company decided to raise prices by 10%.

Tips.title: Gradual Increase
Tips.description: Refers to a gradual or planned increase in levels or amounts, not a sudden spike.
Tips.example: The store will raise the prices slowly over the next year.

Tips.title: Controlled Change
Tips.description: 'Raise' implies a deliberate change decided by someone in control or authority.
Tips.example: Management might raise our targets due to higher demand.

senses.de: to collect or get money for a particular purpose

Tips.title: Joint Effort
Tips.description: To 'raise' funds or resources often involves group effort and collective action.
Tips.example: The community will raise funds to repair the local school.

senses.de: to care for a child until it is an adult, or to care for an animal or plant until it is fully grown
senses.ex: She raised three children on her own.

Tips.title: Long-Term Care
Tips.description: Using 'raise' in this context suggests ongoing support and development over time.
Tips.example: Farmers raise livestock with care and attention.

senses.de: to mention something so that it can be discussed
senses.ex: I'd like to raise a few points during the meeting.

Tips.title: Initiate Discussion
Tips.description: 'Raise' can introduce topics for conversation, implying it's the start of a discussion.
Tips.example: We should raise the issue of schedule changes with the boss.

Advance.wordDefinition:
Advance means to move forward or progress, like when you advance to the next level in a video game or when you advance in your career.

Advance is applicable when talking about progress and moving forward, while raise is applicable when talking about increasing or elevating something.

Boost.wordDefinition:
Boost and raise can both mean to increase something, but there are some subtle differences in the situations where each is used.

Boost is often used to describe increasing something quickly and dramatically. For example, you might boost your energy level by drinking a cup of coffee.

You could also say that a company is hoping to boost their profits by launching a new product.

To summarize: use boost when you want to describe something increasing quickly and dramatically, and use raise when you want to describe a more gradual increase.

Elevate.wordDefinition:
The words elevate and raise both mean to lift something up or make it higher, but they are used in slightly different ways.

Elevate is more commonly used to refer to lifting something to a higher status or position, such as elevating someone to a leadership position, or elevating one's mood.

It can also refer to physically raising something to a higher level, such as elevating a building to avoid flooding.

If you want to talk about lifting something to a higher status or position, use 'elevate.' If you want to talk about physically lifting or increasing something, use 'raise.'

Heighten.wordDefinition:
Heighten means to increase or enhance something, whereas the word raise means to lift something up.

Heighten can describe situations where something is made more intense or amplified, such as heightening emotions or heightening the danger level.

Heighten means to increase something, while raise means to lift something up physically or metaphorically.

Hoist.wordDefinition:
Hoist means to lift something heavy upwards using a pulley or other mechanical device. Raise means to lift something upwards using physical force or other means.

For example, if you wanted to lift a heavy crate to a higher level, you might use a hoist with a rope and pulley system to lift it up.

So in general, hoist is used when lifting heavy objects with mechanical devices, while raise is used when lifting lighter objects or using physical strength to lift something.

Increase.wordDefinition:
Both the words increase and raise mean to make something bigger or higher.

Increase is more often used when talking about quantity or size, such as increasing the number of employees in a company, or increasing the size of a product.

Increase is used more often for quantity or size, while raise is used more often for value or level.

Lift.wordDefinition:
The words lift and raise are similar in meaning, but they have some differences.

Lift means to pick something up from a lower position and raise it to a higher position. For example, you lift a box off the ground and place it on a shelf.

Raise means to move something to a higher position or to cause something to be lifted to a higher position. For example, you can raise your hand to answer a question in class.

Lift is more about physically moving something while raise is more about bringing something higher, either physically or figuratively.

Promote.wordDefinition:
Promote means to support or publicize something to increase its popularity, awareness and sales. For example, a company may promote its product through advertising, social media or other marketing efforts.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Promote is applicable in business and marketing, while raise is applicable in personal and financial contexts.

quotes.Text: I had to make a major decision with myself because I just don't think you can do both: try to have a baby career and raise it and have a baby baby and raise it. And to try to do justice to either one. It was a very conscious decision on my part not to have children - which I have never regretted.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Betty White

quotes.Text: As a lower-class kid, I was raised to think success would be owning stuff. Having that great job, too. Now I find my parents' dream was wrong. You never really own anything. And you're never really finished as a person.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.Text: One thing they never tell you about child raising is that for the rest of your life, at the drop of a hat, you are expected to know your child's name and how old he or she is.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Erma Bombeck

quotes.Text: Well, I say that the most important job you can possibly have is raising a child, and it needs to be treated that way. You have to show them, rather than just talk to them.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: I will cut taxes - cut taxes - for 95 percent of all working families, because, in an economy like this, the last thing we should do is raise taxes on the middle class.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: I think it's important to show a husband and a wife together, in a room, raising children, because you don't see that anymore.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Tyler Perry

quotes.Text: You need a whole community to raise a child. I have raised two children, alone.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Toni Morrison

quotes.Text: Everybody knows how to raise children, except the people who have them.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.Text: All those who believe in psychokinesis - raise my hand.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Steven Wright
